person.persName: Jeremiah Davidson (Greenup County attorney and newspaper publisher)

body.p:
Born on November 4, 1815 in Lawrence County, Ohio. A native of Lawrence County, Ohio. Left Lawrence County in 1828 for Cincinnati where he was instructed in shoemaking, tailoring, and clothing sales. Came to Greenup County, Kentucky in October 1832. Hotel keeper form 1832-1843, while also studying law. Admitted to the bar on October 31, 1846. Served as magistrate and justice of the peace. Editor and proprietors of the Greenup Record, an independent weekly, and the first newspaper published in northeastern Kentucky. First common-school commissioner under the public school law of Kentucky, and held the office several terms.
Married Eliza A. Corum in December 1834. Children included six sons and two daughters, including Henry C., Charles W., Theodore F., Edgar P., and Miss Annie M.

bibl.p: J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville:Battey Publishing, 1886).
